name: my_succ
description: A function which takes one Int as argument and returns its successor.

name: my_is_neg
description: A function which takes one Int as argument and returns True if it’s negative or False otherwise

name: my_abs
description: A function which takes one Int as argument and returns it’s absolute value

name: my_min
description: A function which takes two Ints as arguments and returns the minimum of the two.

name: my_max
description: A function which takes two Ints as arguments and returns the maximum of the two

name: my_tuple
description: A function which takes two arguments and return a tuple of those

name: my_truple
prototype: my_truple :: a -> b -> c -> (a, b, c)
description: A function which takes three arguments and return a tuple of those

name: my_fst
description: A function which takes a tuple as argument and returns its first value.

name: my_snd
description: A function which takes a tuple as argument and returns its second value.

name: mySwap
description: A function which takes a tuple as argument and returns a new tuple, with it’s two values swaped.

name: my_head
description: A function which takes a list as argument and returns its first value. If the list is empty, an exception is raised with the function error.

name: my_tail
description: A function which takes a list as argument and returns a new list without its first element. If the list is empty, an exception is raised with the function error.

name: my_length
description: A function which takes a list as argument and returns the number of elements in the list.

name: my_nth
description: A function which takes a list and an Int (N) as argument and returns the element at index N in the list, or an error if the index is too large or negative

name: my_take
description: A function which takes an Int (N) and a list and returns a list with the Nth first elements of the list. If the list is too short the whole list is returned.

name: my_drop
description: A function which takes an Int (n) and a list and returns a list without the N first elements. If the list is too short an empty list is returned.

name: my_append
description: A function which takes two lists and returns a new list with the second list appened to the first one.

name: my_reverse
description: A function which takes a list and returns a list with all its elements in reverse order.

name: my_init
description: A function which takes a list and returns a list with all its elements except the last one, or an error if the list is empty

name: my_last
description: A function which takes a list and returns its last element, or an error if the list is empty

name: my_zip
description: A function which takes two lists as arguments, and returns a list of tuples. The list produced is as long as the shortest list.

name: my_unzip
description: A function which takes a list of tuples, and return a tuple of lists.

name: my_map
description: A function which takes a function and a list, and apply this function to every element of the list

name: my_filter
description: A function which takes a predicate (a function returning a boolean value) and a list, and returns a list of all the elements for which the predicate has returned True

name: my_foldl
description: A function which takes a function, a starting value and a list as argument. It takes the second argument and the first item of the list and applies the function to them, then feeds the function with this result and the second argument and so on.

name: my_foldr
description: Like myFoldl, but from right to left.

name: my_partition
description: A function which takes a predicate and a list as argument, and returns a tuple of lists, with in the first list the elements for which the predicate returns true, and in the second list the other elements.

name: my_quick_sort
description: A function which takes a predicate and a list as arguments, and returns the list sorted according to the predicate.
